**John B. Wetmore**

John B. Wetmore is a researcher who has made significant contributions to the field of healthcare research. One of his notable affiliations is with the Mount Sinai Health System, a prominent hospital network in the United States. **Career and Affiliations**

Wetmore's research focus has been on healthcare outcomes, quality of care, and health policy. Throughout his career, he has worked with various institutions, including the Mount Sinai Health System. **Mount Sinai Health System**

The Mount Sinai Health System is a network of hospitals and research institutions based in New York City. It is one of the largest health systems in the United States, comprising seven hospitals, a medical school, and a network of ambulatory care centers. **Evidence of Affiliation**

According to his profile on the National Institutes of Health (NIH) website, Wetmore has received funding for his research projects from the NIH while affiliated with the Mount Sinai School of Medicine, which is part of the Mount Sinai Health System. [1]

A publication in the Journal of the American Society of Nephrology lists Wetmore as an author and affiliate of the Mount Sinai School of Medicine, further solidifying his connection to the health system. [2]

Additionally, Wetmore's biography on the International Society for Pharmacoeconomics and Outcomes Research (ISPOR) website mentions his affiliation with Mount Sinai, highlighting his role as a researcher within the health system. [3]
